storyInfo: Mountain embarks on a path of revenge, but his heart is filled with pain.

attributes.content: Drip. Drop.
Is it raining?
He looks out the window. Lightning flashes across the sky, but the glass remains dry.
Tick, tock.
It must be the clock, then.
But he looks up at the clock, and sees that its hands have long since stopped, with only a broken wooden dummy swaying beneath.
What is going on?
His palm feels wet, as though liquid was dripping through his clenched fist and onto the ground, forming a viscous puddle.
He opens up his hand and sees that the hairs of his palm are soaked in blood.
Sinner.
Who's there?!
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Hehe. You're already wearing unbreakable shackles, Anthony.

Another flash of lightning illuminates the corner of the dark room. A severed head lies on the ground, blood still gushing out from where it was separated from its body, leaving it lying in a pool of blood. It is the head that is speaking to him.
He remembers that face. It is a familiar one.
Val Hyde... where is your brother?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Where is he? Right by your feet.
attributes.name: Severed Head

attributes.content: He looks down to see a corpse lying on the ground. Its torso is turned away, yet its head has swiveled around to face him. The broken neck vertebrae protrude from the skin.
Why are you trembling, Anthony? You should be happy.
attributes.name: Broken Corpse

attributes.content: You've waited so long for this day. To kill your hated enemies with your own hands, and let their blood soak every inch of earth here.
attributes.name: Broken Corpse

attributes.content: Did... did I do all this?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Yes. Smile, Anthony. What a day. What a lovely day.
attributes.name: Broken Corpse

attributes.content: You've exacted your revenge, so why the long face? Hehehe.
attributes.name: Severed Head

attributes.content: No... it's too late.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Oh, my child, you came too late. Boo-hoo. Your mom and I didn't live to see the day you walked free again.
attributes.name: Severed Head

attributes.content: It's all too late. Our little Tony. Boo-hoo.
attributes.name: Broken Corpse

attributes.content: Shut up. Shut up!
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Murderer! How dare you pretend to talk like my parents!
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Murderer? Is he taking about us?
attributes.name: Broken Corpse

attributes.content: Yes, brother. He's talking about us.
attributes.name: Severed Head

attributes.content: But look around, Anthony. There's only one person in this room with blood on their hands.
attributes.name: Broken Corpse

attributes.content: It's you. You're the murderer.
attributes.name: Severed Head

attributes.content: You deserved it! You deserved to die by my hands!
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Such brave words, such unwavering resolve. Everything is as you wanted, then. Why not smile, Anthony?
attributes.name: Broken Corpse

attributes.content: Why are your lips pursed like that? Come on, turn that frown upside down. Smile. Laugh. Do as I do.
attributes.name: Severed Head

attributes.content: Enough! Shut up!
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Such terrifying eyes, brother. There's murder in them.
attributes.name: Severed Head

attributes.content: The eyes of a murderer! The eyes of a sinner!
attributes.name: Broken Corpse

attributes.content: Shut! Up!
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Hahaha! We're waiting for you, Anthony. We'll see you in the flames of hell.
attributes.name: Broken Corpse

attributes.content: Is that so?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: I'm already being burnt every day by the flames of revenge.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: What do I care about the flames of hell, as long as I can tear you apart with my own two hands?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: What does a charred corpse have to fear from the fire?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Then come find us, Anthony. Hahahaha.
attributes.name: Severed Head

attributes.content: I will. I'll step into the flames.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: A fire burns in his eyes.
Argh—!
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Argh...
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: It's that dream again... my head...
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: (Covers face) What time is it...?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Good morning, operator. It is currently 0424 hours. Current weather is overcast, and the temperature is 26 degrees.
attributes.name: Communications Terminal

attributes.content: Four in the morning... only three hours of sleep, then.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: ...Forget it, I can't get back to sleep.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: My sheets are soaked with sweat.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: I'll need to change them... the pillow, too.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: You have a new message, operator.
attributes.name: Communications Terminal

attributes.content: Anthony, we found the money your dad left in Bunkerhill City. There's more than enough for us to make a comeback.
attributes.name: Communications Terminal

attributes.content: Are you still haunted by what happened to your parents?
attributes.name: Communications Terminal

attributes.content: It's not your fault. HydeBro carried out their entire plan while you were in Mansfield. By the time we heard the news, it was already too late.
attributes.name: Communications Terminal

attributes.content: The Hyde brothers are nothing if not thorough. It's a miracle that you're still alive.
attributes.name: Communications Terminal

attributes.content: We went to great lengths to get in touch with you. Their eyes and ears are everywhere.
attributes.name: Communications Terminal

attributes.content: Try to pull yourself together. We'll take back what belongs to us.
attributes.name: Communications Terminal

attributes.content: Control, Anthony... don't let violence overcome you... control...
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: (Trembles)
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: ...Damn it.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Damn it!
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: He picks up a chair and throws it at the wall, shattering the dressing mirror mounted there.
He sees his face reflected in the shards, twisted in anger.
Then, the fury fades.
Control, Anthony.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Anger and sorrow have never solved anything.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Training Room
(Gazes into distance)
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: (Hm, he looks distracted...)
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: Snap out of it, big guy!
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: (She's fast... I might hurt her with a hard block. I'll just protect my head.)
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Where do you think you're looking?
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: (Now she's aiming for my midsection!)
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Too late. It's all too late.
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: Huh...?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: No—shut up!
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Ouch!
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: Oh no... I'm sorry, Shura. Are you alright?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: So that's how it is, big guy... You've never really come at me with your full strength, have you?
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: We're in very different weight classes. I'm afraid you wouldn't be able to fight back.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Hmph! It wasn't that bad. Bring it on! Just... gimme a second to get up.
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: Ow ow ow!
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: Apologies, I should have been more careful. I'll take you to sickbay.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: ...Eh, these things happen in training.
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: You look distracted, though. What's the matter? Didn't get much sleep last night?
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: Yes... Maybe I was too absorbed in the book I was reading.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Well, nothing to worry about! Next time we're free, let's grab a few drinks together. That'll knock you right out, if you let 'em.
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: I'd rather not even think about drinking until we get you to a doctor.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: How is she, Domma?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Asleep for now. We'll need to keep her a coupla days for observation, but it don't look too serious to me.
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: How'd she get hurt?
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: I accidentally injured her today.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: Don't look at me like that.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: You ain't the type to lose control, though...
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: Don't look so surprised, Domma. You've seen me in prison.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Yeah, which is why I know just how hard you been tryin' to hide that side of you.
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: You look awful, Anthony.
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: ...I've been having trouble sleeping. Seeing the same nightmare every night.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: In it, I'm standing in a pool of blood, with blood on my hands, and the Hyde brothers are lying dead on the ground.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: That's new, never had no dreams like that before. Somethin' happen?
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: Bad news from Bunkerhill City.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Your folks...
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: Educated guess?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Yeah, saw that letter on your desk when I was returnin' a book. Under a pile of books, but there ain't no hidin' those tear stains.
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: I've submitted my resignation and will be leaving in a few days. I've been here too long. It's time I faced it. Everything.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Figured this day'd come, sooner or later.
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: Sometimes, I can't help but think... what if you left all that behind and stayed here? Wouldn't that be swell?
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: I've considered it, Domma.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Once, I thought I would give up on revenge after I'd rescued my parents.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: But now, my only desire is to repay blood with blood.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: But you ain't never killed no one, Anthony.
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: How does it feel? How does it feel to take a life with your own hands?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Can you tell me, Domma? How did it feel when you injected poison into a prisoner's veins? How did it feel when you sent the body to the incinerator for disposal?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: ...It hurt, at first. You feel sick, can't sleep, start seein' stuff that ain't there.
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: Then, you try to justify it. Tell yourself they deserved it, that you did the right thing.
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: Then, one day, when enough people have stopped breathin' on account of you, you stop feelin' anything at all. You seen enough death.
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: That point, whatever crimes they did in life don't much matter no more. Their deaths don't neither.
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: Does it take a long time?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Yeah, long and painful. Had to keep remindin' myself it was just a job. But how 'bout you, Anthony?
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: How would you get through it?
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: Seems to me you made up your mind to face it without givin' a single thought to how.
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: We're goin' together, Anthony. I can help you.
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: No, this is my problem. I can't drag you into this.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: I's already in it. I helped break you outta Mansfield, 'member?
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: That's enough, Domma, this is not open for discussion.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Anthony—
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: A-Anthony!
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: Are you awake, Shura?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: I hearda you hadda bottle of fine whiskey... when will we getta have a taste of it?
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: How about next Wednesday? Ya free that day, and I'm free that day...
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: Huh? But you're injured. You shouldn't drink for a while.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Injured... ya, I'm injured, can't drink...
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: Why... *sob* I'm so sad... *sob*
attributes.name: Beehunter

attributes.content: (Is she ok?)
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: (Must be the anesthetic.)
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: (I see...)
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Anthony...
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Promise me. Promise me you won't leave without sayin' goodbye.
attributes.name: Domma

attributes.content: ...Alright.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Your exit papers are in order, sir. I'm sure you have plenty on your plate right now, so I took the liberty of bringing the paperwork over.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Sorry, and thank you. I should have come over to pick them up myself.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: It's fine, I just happened to be passing through. Have a nice day, sir.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: You too.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Well, that went quicker than I anticipated.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: (Looks around)
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: I should clean up before I leave. Fortunately, there isn't much here.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: These books... they can go to the library.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: These bottles of liquor... I'll drop them off in the wine storage room.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: ...Oh, I almost forgot, the action movies I borrowed from Robin. I should remember to return them.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: A leaf bookmark from Kafka, and this doll... As I recall, a Christmas present from Pinecone.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: What's with all the trinkets in this drawer? I don't even remember putting them there. No doubt the kids staying at Medical will enjoy them, though.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Well, that's about it. Now to start packing... I should only need a few changes of clothes.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: He freezes.
The suit hangs in the middle of the wardrobe, clear as day. He remembers everything about it, from picking the cloth, to getting measured, to the delivery.
Everyone could see how much he liked it. Everyone thought he would wear it at every opportunity.
In fact, he has hardly ever done so.
He did not want to blemish it.
You have a new message, operator.
attributes.name: Communications Terminal

attributes.content: Got your message, Anthony. We've made arrangements to get you to Bunkerhill City. We have people waiting for you at Tkaronto.
attributes.name: Communications Terminal

attributes.content: I look forward to seeing you. Your parents, my brother... we have so many scores to settle with the Hyde brothers.
attributes.name: Communications Terminal

attributes.content: He lifts a hand and touches a tiny piece of embroidery on the collar.
It is in the shape of a tower.
Eventually, reluctantly, his arm comes back down again.
What a fool I was... Why did I buy this, knowing that I would eventually leave?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Such a fool.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Dr. Silence. Is Domma here?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Sorry, Anthony, you might have to wait. She's treating a patient that came in this afternoon.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: May I wait for her here?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Of course. Water?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: No, thank you. I wouldn't want to get in your way.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Alright, I'll be making my rounds.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: (Glances at watch)
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: I hope there's enough time...
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Young man! Hey, young man!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Oh, sorry, were you speaking to me?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Yeah, for a while now, but seems like you didn't hear me.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I apologize; I was checking the time. Did you need something?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: No, I just saw a hole in your shirt, so I was asking if you could come over so I could fix it.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Thank you. I suppose I didn't notice it because I was in a hurry.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: But I'm afraid I have to leave soon.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Sit down already. Just because I'm old doesn't mean my hands don't work. It'll only take a few minutes.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: ...Thank you, ma'am.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: You're a friend of Dr. Domma's?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: That's what I thought. You're always stopping by to see her.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Are you a patient of hers?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Yeah, she's really nice. I've got bad knees, and she's been a lot of help.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: She's always been kind like that.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: I guess you already know that she's leaving? She told me yesterday that I'm being handed over to Dr. Silence.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: ...Is that so. What a shame.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Must've heard some dumb patient calling her a weirdo behind her back. Silly, really! She's so patient and detailed. You don't get many doctors like her.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I completely agree.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: But I guess that's that. Dr. Silence said she tried to convince her to stay, but she wouldn't change her mind.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: She may be gentle on the surface, but she's stubborn. Once she puts her mind to something, no one can change it.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: After relying on her for everything when I was stuck in a hospital bed, helping fix her friend's clothes is the least I could do.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: There, how's that?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Wonderful. Thank you.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Oh, there's no need to thank me.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: (Glances at watch)
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Are you leaving?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Yes, I have to go.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: You sure you don't want to wait? She'll be done in a minute.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Hold on, you're going by yourself? I thought she was coming with you.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: No, I came to say goodbye. I'm the only one who's leaving.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Oh, I must've misunderstood then. I could've sworn you were taking her with you.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: No, it's better for her to stay at Rhodes Island. My revenge is my own business. I don't want to drag anyone else into it.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Speaking of which, can you do something for me, Dr. Silence?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Well, you can ask.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Can you give this book to her?
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Just a book?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: And a message. Tell her that...
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Tell her I haven't finished it yet. Tell her to keep it safe.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: When will you be back for it? What do I tell her?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Silence is the crueler answer, you know.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: You take care. I need to go now.
attributes.name: Anthony

attributes.content: Anthony!
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Anthony...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: ...*sigh*.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Silence looks down and sees that the corner of one page has been folded. She opens the book and sees an illustration.
A man stands in a prison cell, his back to the window, his face obscured by shadows and iron bars. He extends a wilted finger through the bars and out beyond the picture.
There is a single line of text beneath the illustration.

attributes.text: I have sinned. I have killed. I seek no sympathy, no forgiveness, no salvation. I seek only suffering, and eternal torment.
